subject: RE: [junit] Documentation?
msgSnippet: Updating the Javadocs and creating a link to them is on my list of things todo.  I have 3 days to work on junit.org next week. -- Erik Meade
messageBody:
Updating the Javadocs and creating a link to them is on
my list of things todo. I have 3 days to work on
junit.org next week.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chas Schley [mailto:chas@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 09, 2001 5:56 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Documentation?
>
>
> The links to the online JavaDoc (and FAQ) seems to have been pulled
> from www.junit.org. I have a bookmark to the JavaDoc, but the online
> version appears to document JUnit 3.2. Is someone maintaining a
> public site with the latest JavaDoc (SourceForge doesn't have
> anything in the docs section)?
>
> JUnit 3.5 seems to have introduced the "-noloader" flag to the
> testrunners, causing me much grief until I learned how to turn off
> the default class loader. Where would I go to learn about such
> things without having to grep through the JUnit source code?
>
> Thanks (a mostly satisfied customer :)
>
> _chas_
